subject: Philosophy
title: The Problem of Universals
description: A quick, practical guide to The Problem of Universals.

hook.text: Two red roses share the same color. But where exactly does 'redness' exist?

buildup.text: Realists say redness is a real property that exists independently of any red thing.

discovery.text: Nominalists disagree. 'Redness' is just a word we use to group similar-looking objects.

twist.text: This isn't word games. It determines whether math is discovered or invented.

climax.text: If numbers exist independently, math is discovery. If not, it's the greatest fiction ever written.
